author: Megan Getz
comment: I don't know if I'm doing something wrong but it reads notifications without shaking. I had the watch lying on the table, not moving and my phone still played my text message. I have asus zenwatch 2 running 1.4.  I have jorsay set with shake detection on with shake intensity high and detection duration 10 seconds.  I've also had it spontaneously read a text out loud 30 minutes after it was received.

author: Michael Cooke
comment: I really like this app and it's extremely helpful for when I'm driving. However, my only complaint is that it only uses the phone speaker to read your messages aloud. It would be nice if it would read the messages using your Android Wear speaker. I have a Huawei watch and this would be perfect. Please implement this!
title: Good but needs a little more

author: Brian Machado
comment: My problem is that it's reading all notifications aloud. Even when I'm not wearing the watch.
title: Reading All Aloud

author: Rhythm Rice
comment: I wish you could choose which days it would work also, like i set a parameter so it doesnt go off between 8:10 and 3:02 for school but now all weekend between those hours i cant use it, i want only week days
title: Its okay

author: Owen Davies
comment: Same problem, reads all notifications aloud.  I need it to just read notifications (on my watch, not phone) and only when I shake my wrist. Using LG G4 and Zenwatch 2

author: Md.Kamruzzaman Mazumder
comment: Don't work with moto 360. Reading just from my mobile.

author: Michael Russo
comment: What about my s7? I'd pay 10 bucks for this please. Respond back thanks

author: Aditya Kulkarni
comment: Works very well

author: Matt Estrada
comment: Great since this doesn't spam you with every notification you receive the second you get it, you can choose which apps or all apps, and just twist your wrist twice when you're ready to listen to them. I didn't find much use but I can recommend it.
title: Excellent Idea

author: Nigar sana
comment: Loved the idea, works really good, even though I don't have a watch... I can choose what apps to be read aloud!
title: Great app!

author: chetana b
comment: Reads my notifications aloud!
title: Great little app

author: Kishori Dabade
comment: Great idea for an app, works beautifully
title: Nice app

author: Pg Pg
comment: Really good app
title: Good app

author: Mark Meyer
comment: Interesting concept. It needs a cancel function so if it starts reading an email that just came in that's long, you can quickly shake again to stop it.  Also, you should have a feature that allows the user to enable this "shake to" service only when Bluetooth device is connected like headphones or a car, etc.  Give the user a choice of connected Bluetooth devices to choose.  At least make an activity "start" and "stop" service so it can be read by other apps like Trigger. I'd absolutely pay for an app that fulfilled the above requirements.

reply.author: Mocha17
reply.content:
Thank you for the detailed feedback! 

We do have a 'Snooze' feature - while JorSay is reading, a notification is displayed with options to snooze reading aloud for 1, 3 or 5 minutes. These notification actions are available on Wear device too.

We have plans of adding ActivityRecognition to detect driving mode. 

We will take a look at Trigger.

author: Jose Azua
comment: Love the app but something I can't use from 8 - 5 because of work environment and meetings. Have you thought about adding in a schedule so it only turns on from say 5-8 pm out of work hours?

reply.author: Mocha17
reply.content: That's an excellent suggestion, and we have it on the JorSay feature roadmap. Your feedback will help us with prioritization.

author: Michael Burrows
comment: Works well but the voice is just awful and speaks too fast. Is there any way of having a choice of voices?
title: Good but terrible voice

author: Antonio Salvador
comment: Does what it says on the box. Shake Detection menu is not very clear: is the shake duration the time during which it will look for a shake (therefore higher = more sensitive) or the time during which one needs to shake (therefore higher value is less sensitive)?

author: Konstantin Simonov
comment: Doesn't read non English messages

reply.author: Mocha17
reply.content:
We just rolled out an update (version 2.0.0) with support for languages other than English. Note that device language needs to set accordingly - for example, to Italian for listening to notifications in an Italian voice. Could you please give it a go?

May we request you to revise the rating if you find it satisfactory?

author: Bryan Poteet
comment: I just installed the app and it works as expected. Nice work.
title: Fantastic app!

author: Vinay Rao
comment: Nice work!
title: Good stuff!

author: Ted Hosmer
comment: It just works

author: Sriprabha Gopalan
comment: Love the simple look and feel of the app.
title: A very useful app!

author: Toshi Nehete
comment: Handsfree innovation \m/

author: Ruben Kan
comment: Good app but I primarily wanted to use this to listen to audio messages sent via WeChat and my wear watch doesn't have a speaker. But it won't work for this use case because it just "reads text" and uses TTS. All Jorsay will say is message from so-and-so and "AUDIO" cause that's what the watch displays.
title: Good

author: Melinda Yu
comment: I set the app to be disabled during work hours, yet it went off twice in the office. So embarrassing. Uninstall
title: Setting the times was useless

author: Mohini Nehete
comment: Great little app

author: Aditya kulkarni
comment: It's great, and really useful
